org.threadly.litesockets.utils

Class MergedByteBuffers

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.litesockets.utils.MergedByteBuffers
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TransactionalByteBuffers

    public class MergedByteBuffers
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to combine multiple ByteBuffers into 1 simplish to use interface. It provides most of the features of a single ByteBuffer, but with the ability to perform those operations spanning many ByteBuffers. The idea here is to keep from having to copy around and merge ByteBuffers as much as possible. NOTE: This is not threadSafe. It should only be accessed by 1 thread at a time.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        This method allows you to add ByteBuffers to the MergedByteBuffers. All must be done in order of how you want to pull the data back out.
        Parameters:
        buffer - - The byte buffer to add to the MergedByteBuffers

      • add

        public void add(MergedByteBuffers mbb)
        This method allows you to add a MergedByteBuffers to another MergedByteBuffers. All must be done in order of how you want to pull the data back out.
        Parameters:
        mbb - - The MergedByteBuffers to put into this MergedByteBuffers

      • duplicateAndClean

        public MergedByteBuffers duplicateAndClean()
        This will flush all the data in this MergedByteBuffer into another MergedByteBuffer.
        Returns:
        a new MergedByteBuffer with the data that was in the original one.

        public int indexOf(java.lang.String pattern)
        Like the indexOf in String object this find a pattern of bytes and reports the position they start at.
        Parameters:
        pattern - String pattern to search for
        Returns:
        an int with the offset of the first occurrence of the given .

      • remaining

        public int remaining()
        Check how much data is available in the MergedByteBuffer.
        Returns:
        the current about of space remaining in the MergedByteBuffer.

      • get

        public byte get()
        Returns the next byte stored in the MergedByteBuffer.

      • getLong

        public long getLong()
        Returns the next 8 bytes as a long value.
        Returns:

      • get

        public void get(byte[] destBytes)
        Fills the passed byte[] completely with data from the MergedByteBuffer.
        Parameters:
        destBytes - fills the given byteArray with the next bytes from the MergedByteBuffer.
        Throws:
        java.nio.BufferUnderflowException - if the byte[] is larger then the remaining() in the MergedByteBuffer.

      • nextPopSize

        public int nextPopSize()
        Get the size of the next full ByteBuffer in the queue.
        Returns:
        the size of the next ByteBuffer in the queue.

      • pop

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer pop()
        Get the next Complete ByteBuffer in its entirety. This byteBuffer could be any size and it will just pull it off the queue and return it. If remaining() is 0 you will get an empty ByteBuffer.
        Returns:
        the next byteBuffer in the queue.

      • pull

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer pull(int size)
        Parameters:
        size - size of the ByteBuffer to pull out of the MergedByteBuffer.
        Returns:
        a ByteBuffer of %SIZE% bytes.

      • discard

        public void discard(int size)
        Discard will drop how ever many bytes you tell it to on the floor.
        Parameters:
        size - the number of bytes to discard.

      • getAsString

        public java.lang.String getAsString(int size)
        This will return the specified number of bytes as a String object.
        Parameters:
        size - the number of bytes to put into the string.
        Returns:
        as String Object with set number of bytes in it.
